tit.cmt: “15代” could be rendered in roman numerals, as I have done, or spelled out as “the fifteenth/15th”. “generation” is unnecessary

sen.j: 千 玄室（せん げんしつ、1923年4月19日-）は茶道裏千家前家元15代汎叟宗室。
sen.e: Genshitsu SEN (April 19, 1923 - present) is the fifteenth generation of previous Urasenke (the house of Urasen) iemoto (the head family of a school) of Sado (Japanese tea ceremony), Soshitsu HANSO,.
Genshitsu SEN (April 19, 1923 - present) is the fifteenth iemoto (the head of a family or school) of the Urasenke of Japanese tea ceremony fame, Soshitsu HANSO.
Genshitsu SEN (April 19, 1923 - present) is the fifteenth iemoto (the head of a family or school) of the Urasenke school of Japanese tea ceremony fame, Soshitsu HANSO.

sen.j: 斎号は鵬雲斎。
sen.e: His saigo (the Buddhist name) is Hounsai.
His Buddhist name is Hounsai.
His Buddhist name is Hounsai.

sen.j: 本名は宗興。
sen.e: His real name is Sokyo.
His real name is Sokyo.
His real name is Sokyo.

sen.j: 現在は大宗匠・千玄室と称する。
sen.e: He is currently called Dai Sosho or Dai Genshitsu.
He is currently called Dai Sosho or Dai Genshitsu.
He is currently called Dai Sosho or Dai Genshitsu.

sen.j: 「玄室」と言う名は、千家4代目の仙叟宗室が宗室襲名前に玄室と名乗っており、この事に因んで12代直叟宗室が隠居した際に玄室を名乗った事に由来する。
sen.e: The forth generation of Soshitsu HANSO identified himself as 'Genshitsu' before succession to the name of Soshitsu, and it was originated from the twelfth generation of Soshitsu JIKISHO identified himself as Genshitsu when he retired.

The fourth generation after Soshitsu HANSO identified himself as 'Genshitsu' before succession to the name of Soshitsu, which started when the twelfth Soshitsu JIKISHO identified himself as Genshitsu upon retirement.

The fourth generation Soshitsu HANSO identified himself as 'Genshitsu' before succession to the name of Soshitsu, which started when the twelfth Soshitsu JIKISHO identified himself as Genshitsu upon retirement.

sen.j: 妻は登三子。
sen.e: His wife was Tomiko.
His wife was Tomiko.
His wife was Tomiko.

sen.j: 長男は現家元千宗室 (16代)。
sen.e: His eldest son is the current iemoto, Soshitsu SEN (the sixteenth generation).
His eldest son is the current iemoto, Soshitsu SEN (the sixteenth).
His eldest son is the current iemoto, Soshitsu SEN (the sixteenth).

sen.j: 父は14代碩叟宗室（通称・淡々斎宗室として知られる）。
sen.e: His father was the fourteenth Soshitsu SEKISO (known as Soshitsu TANTANSAI).
His father was the fourteenth Soshitsu SEKISO (known as Soshitsu TANTANSAI).
His father was the fourteenth Soshitsu SEKISO (known as Soshitsu TANTANSAI).

sen.j: 姉は茶道家･冠婚葬祭評論家の塩月弥栄子。
sen.e: His sister is Yaeko SHIOZUKI, a master of the tea ceremony and ceremonial occasions critic.
His sister is Yaeko SHIOZUKI, a master of the tea ceremony and ceremonial occasions critic.
His sister is Yaeko SHIOZUKI, a master of the tea ceremony and ceremonial occasions critic.

sen.j: 宝塚造形芸術大学大学院教授であり、伝統芸術研究領域における指導に当たっている。
sen.e: He is a professor at Takarazuka University of Art and Design and teaches the area of study on traditional arts.
He is a professor at Takarazuka University of Art and Design and teaches traditional arts.
He is a professor at Takarazuka University of Art and Design and teaches traditional arts.

sen.j: 1973年11月、藍綬褒章。
sen.e: In November 1973, he won Ranju hosho (the Medal with Blue Ribbon).
In November 1973, he won Ranju hosho (the Medal with Blue Ribbon).
In November 1973, he won Ranju hosho (the Medal with Blue Ribbon).

sen.j: 1980年11月、紫綬褒章。
sen.e: In November 1980, he won Shiju hosho (the Medal with Purple Ribbon).
In November 1980, he won Shiju hosho (the Medal with Purple Ribbon).
In November 1980, he won Shiju hosho (the Medal with Purple Ribbon).

sen.j: 1989年11月、文化功労者として顕彰される。
sen.e: In November 1989, he was presented as Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits).
In November 1989, he was designated a Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits).
sen.cmt: “designated” makes more sense in this context
sen.e: In November 1989, he was designated a Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits).

sen.j: 1994年4月、勲ニ等旭日重光章。
sen.e: In April 1994, he won the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Star.
In April 1994, he won the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Star.
In April 1994, he won the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Star.

sen.j: 1997年11月、茶道界としては初の文化勲章授与。
sen.e: In November 1997, he won the Order of Culture for first time in the tea ceremony world.
In November 1997, he became the first person to win the Order of Culture for the tea ceremony.
In November 1997, he became the first person to win the Order of Culture for the tea ceremony.

sen.j: 1998年4月、フランス・レジオンドヌール勲章オフィシエ章。
sen.e: In April 1998, he won the Legion d'Honneur, Officier of France.
In April 1998, he won the Legion d'Honneur, Officier of France.
In April 1998, he won the Legion d'Honneur, Officier of France.

sen.j: 同年5月、タイ王国・ディレクナポーン勲章
sen.e: In May 1998, he won the Order of the Direkgunabhorn, Kingdom of Thailand.
In May 1998, he won the Order of the Direkgunabhorn, Kingdom of Thailand.
In May 1998, he won the Order of the Direkgunabhorn, Kingdom of Thailand.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief personal history

sen.j: 1923年4月19日、裏千家14代家元碩叟宗室の長男として産まれる。
sen.e: On April 19, 1923, he was born as the eldest son of Soshitsu SEKISO, the fourteenth generation of Urasenke iemoto.
On April 19, 1923, he was born as the eldest son of Soshitsu SEKISO, the fourteenth Urasenke iemoto.
On April 19, 1923, he was born as the eldest son of Soshitsu SEKISO, the fourteenth Urasenke school iemoto.

sen.j: 1943年、学徒動員により第14期海軍予備学生として海軍に入隊。
sen.e: In 1943, he entered navy as the first navy preliminary student due to student mobilization.
In 1943, he entered the navy as the first navy preliminary student due to student mobilization.
In 1943, he entered the navy as the fourteenth navy preliminary student due to student mobilization.

sen.j: 舞鶴の海兵団から土浦の航空隊に転属し、士官になるための基礎訓練を受ける。
sen.e: He was transferred from Maizuru Kaiheidan (marine team) to Tsuchiura Fleet Air Force and received basic training to be an officer.
He was transferred from Maizuru Kaiheidan (marine team) to Tsuchiura Fleet Air Force and received basic training to be an officer.
He was transferred from Maizuru Kaiheidan (marine team) to Tsuchiura Fleet Air Force and received basic training to be an officer.

sen.j: 徳島の航空隊に転属になり、海軍少尉に任官。
sen.e: He was transferred to Tokushima Fleet Air Force and appointed to the navy shojo (junior lieutenant).
He was transferred to the Tokushima Fleet Air Force and appointed to the rank of junior lieutenant.
He was transferred to the Tokushima Fleet Air Force and appointed to the rank of junior lieutenant.

sen.j: 1945年、特別攻撃隊（通称･特攻隊）に志願。
sen.e: In 1945, he volunteered to enter a suicide corps (known as Tokkotai).
In 1945, he volunteered to enter a suicide corps (known as Tokkotai).
In 1945, he volunteered to enter a suicide corps (known as Tokkotai).

sen.j: 同年10月、終戦に付き除隊。
sen.e: In October 1945, he left the corps since the war ended.
In October 1945, he left the corps since the war had ended.
In October 1945, he left the corps since the war had ended.

sen.j: 同志社大学法経学部経済学科に復学。
sen.e: He reentered Doshisha University Faculty of Economics.
He reentered Doshisha University Faculty of Economics.
He reentered Doshisha University Faculty of Economics.

sen.j: 1946年、同志社大学卒業。
sen.e: He graduated from Doshisha University in 1946.
He graduated from Doshisha University in 1946.
He graduated from Doshisha University in 1946.

sen.j: 1949年6月、大徳寺管長後藤瑞巌老大師につき得度。
sen.e: In June 1949, he took Buddhist vows under Zuigan GOTO Ro-Daishi (old great teacher), chief abbot of Daitoku-ji Temple.
In June 1949, he took Buddhist vows under Zuigan GOTO Ro-Daishi, chief abbot of Daitoku-ji Temple.
In June 1949, he took Buddhist vows under Zuigan GOTO Ro-Daishi, chief abbot of Daitoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 斎号鵬雲斎を授く。
sen.e: He received saigo Hounsai.
He received saigo Hounsai.
He received saigo Hounsai.

sen.j: 1950年、ハワイ大学に修学。
sen.e: He studied at Hawaii University in 1950.
He studied at University of Hawaii in 1950.
sen.cmt: I think “university of hawaii” is the correct name
sen.e: He studied at University of Hawaii in 1950.

sen.j: 1959年、日本青年会議所会頭に就任。
sen.e: He was appointed to the president of Junior Chamber International Japan in 1959.
He was appointed to the president of Junior Chamber International Japan in 1959.
He was appointed to the president of Junior Chamber International Japan in 1959.

sen.j: 1964年、父宗室死去により千利休居士15代裏千家今日庵家元宗室襲名。
sen.e: In 1964, due to his father Soshitsu's death, he succeeded to the name of Soshitsu of the fifteenth generation of Urasenke Konnichian iemoto of SEN no Rikyu, a lay Buddhist.
In 1964, due to his father Soshitsu's death, he succeeded to the name of Soshitsu as the fifteenth Urasenke Konnichian iemoto after SEN no Rikyu.
In 1964, due to his father Soshitsu's death, he succeeded to the name of Soshitsu as the fifteenth Urasenke school Konnichian iemoto after SEN no Rikyu.

sen.j: 2002年12月、千宗室 (16代)に家元継承。
sen.e: On December 2002, he transferred iemoto position to Soshitsu SEN (the sixteenth generation).
On December 2002, he transferred the iemoto position to Soshitsu SEN the sixteenth.
On December 2002, he transferred the iemoto position to Soshitsu SEN the sixteenth.

sen.j: 玄室に改名。
sen.e: He changed his name to Genshitsu.
He changed his name to Genshitsu.
He changed his name to Genshitsu.

sen.j: 人物
sen.e: Personality
Personality
Personality

sen.j: 同年生まれ（学年は千が1年下）で俳優西村晃と特攻隊で同じ隊に所属していた。
sen.e: The actor, Ko NISHIMURA was born on the same year (Sen was one grade below him) and belonged to the same corps in Tokkotai.
The actor Ko NISHIMURA was born in the same year (Sen was one grade below him) and belonged to the same corps in Tokkotai.
The actor Ko NISHIMURA was born in the same year (Sen was one grade below him) and belonged to the same corps in Tokkotai.

sen.j: 徳島より串良海軍航空基地に移動する、即ち特攻作戦が近日中に行われるであろう日に、飛行訓練後、自分達が乗る飛行機の機体の傍で手持ちの道具と配給の羊羹で5人の隊員全員と茶会を催した事は、戦後西村の述懐・自身の著作や講演など広く知られる。
sen.e: On the day he moved to Kushira Navy Base from Tokushima,more specifically when suicide mission was about to happen within days, it was widely known by Nishimura's remembrance after the war or Sen's books or talks that after the flight training, all five members of the corps had tea party with tools in hand and supplied adzuki-bean jellies beside the airframe which they rode.

On the day he moved to Kushira Navy Base from Tokushima in advance of a suicide mission, according to Nishimura's remembrance after the war and Sen's books and talks, after flight training all five members of the corps gathered next to their airplanes for a tea party with tools that they had on hand and adzuki-bean jellies from their rations.

On the day he moved to Kushira Navy Base from Tokushima in advance of a suicide mission, according to Nishimura's remembrance after the war and Sen's books and talks, after flight training all five members of the corps gathered next to their airplanes for a tea party with tools that they had on hand and adzuki-bean jellies from their rations.

sen.j: 西村は出撃したが機体故障の為引き返し、自身は出撃する事が無かった為同隊ではこの2人のみが生還した。
sen.e: Nishimura departed once but came back due to the airframe breakdown and Sen never departed, so they were the only two who survived within the corps. NHK Human Lecture, August-September term in 2004, Wednesdays "Heart of Tea to the World, Genshitsu SEN."

Nishimura departed but came back because his plane broke down, and Sen never departed, so they were the only two from the corps who survived. NHK Human Lecture, August-September 2004, Wednesdays "Heart of Tea to the World, Genshitsu SEN."
Nishimura departed but came back because his plane broke down, and Sen never departed, so they were the only two from the corps who survived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: NHK人間講座、2004年8月～9月期・水曜日『茶のこころ 世界へ 千玄室』
sen.e: NHK Human Lecture, August-September 2004, Wednesdays "Heart of Tea to the World, Genshitsu SEN."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 1997年に西村が死去した際、故人の遺言に従って葬儀委員長を務めた。
sen.e: When Nishimura died in 1997, Sen served as funeral chairman by the will of the deceased.
When Nishimura died in 1997, Sen served as funeral chairman by the will of the deceased.
When Nishimura died in 1997, Sen served as funeral chairman by the will of the deceased.

sen.j: 著書
sen.e: Author
Authored Works
sen.cmt: “author” is a person who writes something. “著書” is something that an author wrote
